item.title: Cultural Ministry takes elaborate programs on Shahid dibash
item.description: Cultural Affairs Ministry has taken elaborate programmes marking the Shahid Dibash and International Mother Language Day. item.title: Pakistan, US sign pact to redevelop New York's Roosevelt Hotel
item.description: Pakistan has signed an agreement with the United States to jointly redevelop New York's Roosevelt Hotel, according to four official documents reviewed by Reuters and two sources, in a deal between the two governments that will allow Islamabad to unlock the value of one its most prized overseas inve

item.title: Two killed, 10 injured in Madaripur road accident
item.description: Two people were killed and 10 others injured in a road accident in Melkai area of Dasar upazila in Madaripur district on Thursday afternoon. According to eyewitnesses and police, a passenger bus of Imran Paribahan, traveling from Dhaka to Barishal, collided head-on with a BRTC bus coming from the

item.title: Health Minister for on-site monitoring to ensure quality healthcare services
item.description: Health and Family Welfare Minister Sardar Md Sakhawat Hossain today (Thursday) announced that the government will conduct on-site monitoring at hospitals to ensure that doctors are providing proper and timely services to patients. He made the announcement while speaking as the chief guest at an or

item.title: Russia warns of escalating Iran tensions amid US military build up
item.description: Russia warned against an “unprecedented escalation of tension” around Iran on Thursday and urged restraint amid a US military build-up in the region that a senior American official said should be complete by mid-March. US threats to bomb Iran, with the two sides far apart in talks on T

item.title: After Milano Cortina, Veneto's former governor pushes Venice bid for 2036, 2040 Games
item.description: In the wake of the Milano Cortina Olympics, the former governor of the Veneto region wants to put forward the city of Venice and the surrounding Italian regions as candidates to host the 2036 or 2040 Summer Olympics, with a focus on preserving the lagoon city. item.title: ‘Consensus collections not extortion’: Rabiul
item.description: Road Transport and Communications Minister Shaikh Rabiul Alam has said that money collected from transport operators “on a consensual basis” should not be considered extortion. Speaking to reporters at his office in the Secretariat on Thursday, he clarified: “What is called extor

item.title: Govt initiates 'family card' pilot in 8 divisions
item.description: The government has moved to launch the “family card” programme on a pilot basis across eight Upazilas in as many divisions of the country, fulfilling a key electoral pledge to strengthen social security for low-income households. A 15-member ministerial committee, headed by New Finance

item.title: India's Kaur becomes highest-capped woman in international cricket
item.description: Harmanpreet Kaur became the highest-capped player in women’s international cricket when she made her 356th appearance for India in Thursday’s Twenty20 match against Australia, surpassing New Zealand great Suzie Bates. Indian captain Kaur, 36, has now played six Tests, 161 One-Day

item.title: King Charles visits London fashion show after brother's arrest
item.description: Britain's King Charles appeared at a fashion show in London on Thursday just hours after his brother Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor was arrested on suspicion of misconduct in public office. Charles greeted onlookers with a wave when he arrived at Tolu Coker's London Fashion Week show and was met with

item.title: Asif Nazrul vacates govt residence
item.description: Former law advisor Asif Nazrul has announced that he is leaving his official residence on Hare Road, sharing an emotional message on social media about his attachment to the place. item.title: HSC form fill-up fees rise as registration set to begin Mar 1
item.description: The cost of appearing for the Higher Secondary Certificate (HSC) and equivalent examinations has increased this year, with the maximum fee for filling out the form for the exams fixed at Tk 2,995.
